alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Borden; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 6:17PM CST until February 26 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Glasscock County in western Texas... Southeastern Andrews County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Eastern Ward County in western Texas... Midland County in western Texas... Crane County in western Texas... North central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Ector County in western Texas... Mitchell County in western Texas... Northwestern Reagan County in western Texas... Borden County in western Texas... Howard County in western Texas... Southern Martin County in western Texas... Upton County in western Texas... * Until 815 PM CST. * At 617 PM CST, a dust channel was 10 miles south of Greenwood, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 88 and 151, and between mile markers 164 and 228. Locations impacted include... Midland, Odessa, Big Spring, Snyder, Colorado City, Crane, Greenwood, Gail, Garden City, Coahoma, Loraine, Grandfalls, Goldsmith, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Midland International Air and Space Port and Inadale. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.

area.areaDesc: Andrews; Borden; Crane; Ector; Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Pecos; Reagan; Scurry; Upton; Ward
